## Overview
This post is going to review my peer Nguyễn Đăng Thành R package [`icecovid19`](https://github.com/etc5523-2020/r-package-assessment-Thanh-8213). The package is aiming to launch the shinyapp made before and refactor some output as function. 

To download the package, you can 

```
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("etc5523-2020/r-package-assessment-Thanh-8213")
```
The data set in package:

- **data_total**

The dataset contains the number of COVID19 cases worldwide from 22/01/2020 to 06/10/2020 as well as the date and the region in which cases were recored. There are 3 type of cases: Confirmed, deceased and recovered

- **data_total_newdaily**

The dataset contains the number of COVID19 cases worldwide from 22/01/2020 to 06/10/2020. Data is in longer format, with variable vars contains 6 types of cases: Confirmed, deceased, recovered, new daily confirmed, new daily death and new daily recovered.


The functions in package:

- `launch_app`
This function designed for launch the shinyapp.

- `addLabel`
This function create HTML label for the types of cases. When mouse is hovered
on leaflet map, the label will appear and give addition details. 

- `getSummaryDT`
This function create a summary data table that shows the detailed number of confirmed, deceased and Estimated recovered cases. 

- `sliderDateinput`
The function constructs a slider widget to select a date value from a range of value.
                                  
- `summariseData`
The function summarise data creates a new data frame. It will have one row for each combination 
of grouping variables.

= `summariseData_newdaily`
Summarise Data newdaily daily new cases
